member.name: T:Accord.IO.ExcelReader
member.summary: Excel file reader using Microsoft Jet Database Engine.

remarks.para: This class requires the Microsoft Access Database Engine to work. The download is available from Microsoft under the name "Microsoft Access Database Engine 2010 Redistributable", available in both 32-bit (x86) and 64-bit (x64) versions.

By default, the redistributable package will only install if it is the same as the current version of Microsoft Office installed in the machine (i.e. ACE 32-bit can not be installed with 64-bit office and vice-versa). To overcome this limitation and install both versions of the ACE drivers, specify /passive as a command line argument when installing the packages.

member.name: M:Accord.IO.ExcelReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new spreadsheet reader.
member.param: The stream containing the spreadsheet file.
True if the file should be treated as .xlsx file, false otherwise.
True if the spreadsheet contains headers, false otherwise.
True to read "intermixed" data columns as text, false otherwise.

member.summary: Creates a new spreadsheet reader.
member.param: The path of for the spreadsheet file.
True if the spreadsheet contains headers, false otherwise.
True to read "intermixed" data columns as text, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Accord.IO.SparseReader
member.summary: Reader for data files containing samples in libsvm's sparse format.

example.para: The following example shows how to read all sparse samples from a file and retrieve them as a dense multidimensional vector.
Additionally, it is also possible to read each sample individually and sequentially. For this, we can use a while loop until we reach the end of the stream.

member.name: T:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType
member.summary: Solver types allowed in LibSVM/Liblinear model files.

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown solver type.

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.L2RegularizedLogisticRegression
member.summary: L2-regularized logistic regression in the primal (-s 0, L2R_LR).

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.L2RegularizedL2LossSvcDual
member.summary: L2-regularized L2-loss support vector classification in the dual (-s 1, L2R_L2LOSS_SVC_DUAL, the default).

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.L2RegularizedL2LossSvc
member.summary: L2-regularized L2-loss support vector classification in the primal (-s 2, L2R_L2LOSS_SVC).

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.L2RegularizedL1LossSvcDual
member.summary: L2-regularized L1-loss support vector classification in the dual (-s 3, L2R_L1LOSS_SVC_DUAL).

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.MulticlassSvmCrammerSinger
member.summary: Support vector classification by Crammer and Singer (-s 4, MCSVM_CS).

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.L1RegularizedL2LossSvc
member.summary: L1-regularized L2-loss support vector classification (-s 5, L1R_L2LOSS_SVC).

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.L1RegularizedLogisticRegression
member.summary: L1-regularized logistic regression (-s 6, L1R_LR).

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.L2RegularizedLogisticRegressionDual
member.summary: L2-regularized logistic regression in the dual (-s 7, L2R_LR_DUAL).

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.L2RegularizedL2LossSvr
member.summary: L2-regularized L2-loss support vector regression in the primal (-s 11, L2R_L2LOSS_SVR).

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.L2RegularizedL2LossSvrDual
member.summary: L2-regularized L2-loss support vector regression in the dual (-s 12, L2R_L2LOSS_SVR_DUAL).

member.name: F:Accord.IO.LibSvmSolverType.L2RegularizedL1LossSvrDual
member.summary: L2-regularized L1-loss support vector regression in the dual (-s 13, L2R_L1LOSS_SVR_DUAL).

member.name: P:Accord.IO.LibSvmModel.Solver
member.summary: Gets or sets the solver type used to create the model.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.LibSvmModel.Classes
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of classes that this classification model can handle.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.LibSvmModel.Bias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether an initial double value should be appended in the beginning of every feature vector. If set to a negative number, this functionality is disabled. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.LibSvmModel.Dimension
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of dimensions (features) the classification or regression model can handle.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.LibSvmModel.Labels
member.summary: Gets or sets the class label for each class this classification model expects to handle.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.LibSvmModel.Weights
member.summary: Gets or sets the vector of linear weights used by this model, if it is a compact model. If this is not a compact model, this will be set to null.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.LibSvmModel.Vectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of support vectors used by this model. If the model is compact, this will be set to null.

member.name: T:Accord.IO.MatReader
member.summary: Reader for .mat files (such as the ones created by Matlab and Octave).

remarks.para: MAT files are binary files containing variables and structures from mathematical processing programs, such as MATLAB or Octave. In MATLAB, .mat files can be created using its save and load functions. For the moment, this reader supports only version 5 MAT files (Matlab 5 MAT-file).

The MATLAB file format is documented at
http://www.mathworks.com/help/pdf_doc/matlab/matfile_format.pdf

member.name: M:Accord.IO.MatReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new .
member.param: The input stream containing the MAT file.

member.name: M:Accord.IO.MatReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new .
member.param: The input stream containing the MAT file.
Pass true to automatically transpose matrices if they have been stored differently from .NET's default row-major order. Default is true.

member.name: M:Accord.IO.MatReader.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.summary: Gets the human readable description of the MAT file.

member.summary: Gets the version information about the file. This field should always contain 256.

member.summary: Gets whether the MAT file uses the Big-Endian standard for bit-order. Currently, only little endian is supported.

member.summary: Gets whether matrices will be auto-transposed to .NET row and column format if necessary.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.IdxReader.Magic
member.summary: MNIST's magic number. See remarks for more details

remarks.para: The magic number is an integer (MSB first). The first 2 bytes are always 0. The third byte codes the type of the data. The 4-th byte codes the number of dimensions of the vector/matrix: 1 for vectors, 2 for matrices.
